comment: Here it is obvious that the open c-file is of dominating importance. The routine idea of occupying the furthest available square on the open file is already on the cards; Black can play ... Nb6-c4. White can hardly occupy c5 just yet, not having played Pb4. From this point of view, Black is a little ahead. On the other hand, White retains the option of evicting a Black piece from c4 by playing Pb3. While Black holds the initiative, however, this may not be an easy matter
